results.title: Angela's ashes [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Allan Parker, Scott Rudin, David Brown and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: After immigrating to America, young Frank and his family move back to Limerick following the death of his infant sister. The family is forced to live in the slums of Ireland, with conditions being much worse than they were in America. His Northern Irish father, Malachy, has difficulty finding work because of his former loyalty to the IRA, and what little money he earns, he drinks away, leaving Frank, his mother Angela, and his young brother to scrounge for coal and beg for food and clothing. Determined to escape the poverty, illness, and death that surrounds him in Ireland, Frank dreams of returning to America. Cast includes Emily Watson and Robert Carlyle. Based on the Pulitzer Prize winning autobiography by Frank McCourt.

results.title: eXistenZ = Existenz [DVD]
results.creator_credit: David Cronenberg, Andras Hamori, Robert Lantos, Serendipity Point Films and Alliance Atlantis
results.brief_description: Inspired by a 1995 interview with writer Salman Rushdie, “Existenz” sees Cronenberg apply his perverse and rigorous intellect to a future world in which video game technology and genetic engineering have combined. Allegra Geller (Jennifer Jason Leigh) is a whiz-bang game creator who is the target of an assassination attempt. Geller’s creations simulate the exact sensory and physiological experiences of human reality and she becomes a target of a fundamentalist “realist” cult who object to her experimentation with consciousness. Jude Law plays a young man hired to protect Geller and she introduces him to the labyrinthe, exotic and sometimes terrifying world of virtual reality. Unlike much science-fiction which explores the virtual future, Cronenberg is not as much interested in the possibilities of special effects as he is with the question of what effect do experimentations with computers, designer drugs and genetics have with our ability to understand consciousness and human will. In the near future of “Existenz”, it is not only the human sense of reality that is altered, but our very physical selves. The film itself is a fast paced, ever-changing rollercoaster ride which takes us through myriad permutations of setting and character that in itself unfolds like a video game. As always in Cronenberg’s films, the production design, sound and cinematography is excellent. “Existenz” is a rarity: a film as visceral as it is cerebral.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Cronenberg, Andras Hamori, Robert Lantos, Serendipity Point Films and Alliance Atlantis

results.title: The Patriot [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Roland Emmerich, Gary Levinsohn, Mark Gordon, Dean Devlin, Centropolis Entertainment, Mutual Film Company and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: A historical drama set during the American Revolution, based on the true story of war hero, General Francis Marion. Following the death of his wife, Colonel Benjamin Martin is content to abandon his post in the army to raise his seven children on his plantation in South Carolina. Turning his back on violence, Benjamin is stunned when his oldest son, Gabriel, leaves home and joins the fight against the British Army, despite his father’s refusal to join the Continental Army. Gabriel is injured and makes his way home to warn his family the war is getting closer. His warning is too late however, and when the English arrive, a fight breaks out on Benjamin’s plantation. When Colonel Tavington kills his son, Thomas, and captures Gabriel, Benjamin rethinks his decision not to fight. Vowing to avenge his son’s death, he rescues Gabriel and together they form a militia group, made up of Carolina patriots who will do anything to stop the British troops, and their leader Lord General Cornwallis. Cast includes Mel Gibson, Heath Ledger, Joely Richardson, Jason Isaacs and Tom Wilkinson.

results.title: Girl interrupted [DVD]
results.creator_credit: James Mangold, Cathy Konrad, Douglas Wick and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Failing to convince a psychiatrist that she is sane after overdosing on aspirins and vodka, troubled teen Susanna Kaysen (Winona Ryder) is prescribed a period of genuine rest at renowned mental institution, Claymoore. Further diagnosed with borderline personality disorder - symptoms of which are mental instability, pessimism, and social contrariness - Susanna is locked away from the outer world and thrust into the company of a group of disturbed young women including Georgina (Clea DuVall), a pathological liar, Daisy (Brittany Murphy), a woman suffering a bizarre eating disorder, and Lisa (Angelina Jolie), a charismatically cruel sociopath. Intrigued by Lisa, Susanna rebels against the authority represented by Nurse Valerie and Dr. Wick, and befriends her fellow inmates, allowing herself to become caught up in their collective madness. Forming a love-hate relationship with Lisa becomes the catalyst for events that ultimately help Susanna to resolve many inner conflicts, and fight her way back to sanity. Based on the autobiographical novel of the same name by Susanna Kaysen. (Awards: Academy for Best Supporting Actress, Anjelina Jolie, 1999)

results.title: The Wild one [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Laslo Benedek, Stanley Kramer and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: A group of youths in a motorcycle gang ride into a small Californian town and begin to terrorize the locals. Johnny, the leader of the gang, falls in love with a woman in town but any hope for their relationship is ruined by both the aggression of his fellow bikers, and the prejudices and closed-mindedness of the town’s people. “The Wild one” is one of many Hollywood movies to represent the emerging sub-cultures of alienated and dissatisfied Western youth who were the immediate predecessors to the generation in the sixties who were to create the upheaval of the “counter- culture”. Initially banned in Australia on its release, “The Wild one” is also notable for Marlon Brando’s electrifying performance as Johnny and its (then) innovative use of a rock and roll music score.

results.title: Mary Shelley's Frankenstein [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Branagh, David Parfitt, John Veitch, James V. Hart, Francis Ford Coppola, Indieprod, Japan. National Tourist Organisation, American Zoetrope and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: At the dawn of the 19th Century, inspired by genius and driven by madness, Victor Frankenstein’s quest for immortality creates an unspeakable terror. Frankenstein is one of the most famous and chilling epic tales. The power and spirit of Mary Shelley’s profound Gothic legend is brought to life in this terrifying, passionate and haunting cinematic masterpiece. An electrifying, full-blooded love story starring Robert De Niro (Creature), Kenneth Branagh (Victor Frankenstein), Tom Hulce (Henry), Helena Bonham Carter (Elizabeth) and Aidan Quinn (Walton). Cast also includes John Cleese (Professor Waldman), Ian Holm (Victor’s father) and Richard Briers (Grandfather).

results.title: Jumanji [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Joe Johnston, William Teitler, Scott Kroopf and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: For 26 years Adrian Parrish has been trapped inside an ancient board game called Jumanji. The two children who release him also unwittingly unleash a group of wild jungle creatures who go on a rampage. Alan must save his hometown from destruction or risk being exiled back into the game. Cast includes Robin Williams as Adrian Parrish.

results.title: Eight millimeter [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Joel Schumacher, Gavin Polone, Judy Hofflund and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: A widow settling her husband’s estate, finds an 8mm film in his safe. The film on the reel is a “snuff” film, and shows a young girl being tortured and killed. Upset by the film, she hires private detective Tom Welles (Nicolas Cage) to find the girl on the film and determine if the film is real. When Tom learns the girl on the film is a runaway, his investigation takes him to Hollywood, where with the help of Max (Joaquin Phoenix), a clerk in an adult bookstore, he discovers the world of underground pornography, and his initial investigation becomes an obsession.

results.title: Psycho (1998) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Gus Van Sant, Brian Grazer, Image Entertainment and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Gus Van Sant’s faithful scene by scene colour ‘recreation’ (the term preferred by the director over ‘remake’) of Hitchcock’s classic thriller about the fate of Marion Crane (Anne Heche in the role made famous by Janet Leigh) who, on-the-run with a large amount of stolen cash, stops at an isolated motel run by Norman Bates (Vince Vaughn) , where she meets an untimely end. Cast also includes Julianne Moore as Marion’s sister and William H. Macy as the private investigator she hires to find her sister.

results.title: The Return of Martin Guerre = Le Retour de Martin Guerre
results.creator_credit: Daniel Vigne, Marcel Dassault Productions, FR3 and SFP
results.brief_description: In rural France during the Hundred Years’ War, an unhappy young man (Gerard Depardieu) vanishes from his village leaving his wife and his farm behind. Nine years later he returns a changed person, ostensibly having fought in the war. Though his appearance has altered beyond recognition, his wife (Nathalie Baye), finding him a much better lover and more responsible man than the one that left, accepts him wholeheartedly. Yet the villagers who knew him suspect he is not the man he claims to be, even though he possesses an insider’s knowledge of their lives. Matters come to a head when charges of deception are laid against him and Guerre is forced to defend his identity or face a death sentence. The ensuing court case of raises questions about the nature of identity, memory, perception, and how the passage of time can blur all three. This film was remade in Hollywood under the title “Sommersby” (1993) (also held in the collection). In French with English subtitles.
